revised_title: Natural History of Carolina and the Bahama Islands
tldr: The author, Mark Catesby, presents an extensive account of the natural history of Carolina and the Bahama Islands, including descriptions of various animals, plants, and their environments. He provides detailed observations of birds, beasts, fish, serpents, insects, and plants, as well as the air, soil, and water of the region. Catesby also discusses agriculture, grain, pulse, roots, and other productions of the area, and shares his experiences living in the region for nearly four years.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Zoology and Botany
